link:labelLink.link:label: Accounting Entries SA
Root for XBRL GL. No entry made here.
Document Information SA
Parent for descriptive information about the accountingEntries section in which it is contained.
Document Type

account: information to fill in a chart of accounts file. balance: the results of accumulation of a complete and validated list of entries for an account (or a list of account) in a specific period - sometimes called general ledger entries: a list of individual accounting entries, which might be posted/validated or nonposted/validated journal: a self-balancing (Dr = Cr) list of entries for a specific period including beginning balance for that period. ledger: a complete list of entries for a specific account (or list of accounts) for a specific period; note - debits do not have to equal credits. assets: a listing of open receivables, payables, inventory, fixed assets or other information that can be extracted from but are not necessarily included as part of a journal entry. trialBalance: the self-balancing (Dr = Cr) result of accumulation of a complete and validated list of entries for the entity in a complete list of accounts in a specific period. taxtables: aids automated interpretation of instances that represent tax tables; Tax table are defined by using multiple [taxes] structures to gather the population of codes, authorities and rates; through [taxTableCode] cross-references in the [taxes] structure, these "master file" tax tables can be referenced. Often sorted by date or by account, these terms have specific, and sometimes different, meanings in different areas. Common practice will drive accounting method/term matches.
Audit Number
Unique identifier for this file.
Language
Primary language of the intellectual content. Where practical, the content of this field should coincide with ISO 639-1988 language codes.
Creation Date
Date/time file was created.
Document Comment
Text for entire document.
Period Covered Start
Start of date range for contents. Used as basis for many assumptions about data, including the date as of which open balances are open.
Period Covered End
End of date range for contents. Used as basis for many assumptions about data, including the date as of which open balances are open.
Creator
Identifies the creator of the XBRL instance.
Source Application
Product or service that produced this file. Used by many systems (e.g., VAT). Version number can be included or extended.
(Default Currency) Currency
The reference association to the Default Currency Currency class, which is a class holds information about different currencies.
Code
The official code of the currency utilized in the accounting and/or ERP system.
Entity Information SA
Holder for entity information - information about the reporting organization.
Organization
Section which contains various identifiers for the company.
ID

Code representing the company or organization whose data this file represents: used for situations where one user (e.g., a CPA) needs to keep track of multiple organizations' files (e.g., multiple clients). Can be EIN#, client #, internal/external identifier, SIC code. Codes which identifies the entity. Includes the code identifier of the authority issuing the code, a colon, and the code itself. For example, CIK:01234567 for the CIK number issued by SEC EDGAR.
Description
Text for organization identified by organizationIdentifier. Any descriptive information about the code.
Entry Header SA
Parent for entry headers/journal entry headers.
Entry Identifier
Identifier within source journal
Entry Detail SA
Parent for entry detail
Line Number
Identifier for a particular entry detail
Line Number Counter
Unique reference for the line - a numeric counter
Amount
A class that specifies a value of money in a given currency.
Value
The numerical value representing a sum of money.
Currency
The reference association to the Currency class, which is a class holds information about different currencies.
Code
The official code of the currency utilized in the accounting and/or ERP system.
Identifier Reference SA
Identification for customer, vendor, or employee.
ID
Internal ID Number associated with identifierReference
Registered Entity Identifier SA
Structure containing references to an external authority associated with identifier
Verification Date
Date on which the External Authority last performed a verification
Contact SA
Information about contacts.
Last Name
Last or family name
First Name
First or given name
Measurable SA

Parent for information regarding measurable items associated with the enclosing entryDetail line. Primary area used for holding performance measures. Based on needs for tracking inventory transactional detail, but suitable for anything assigned to an "account", "reporting bucket" or "code". Can be used to track any movements.
Measurable Identification
Internal inventory part or SKU number or other code identifier for the measurable.
Schema for Measurable Identification
URI or other identifier for schema with which measurable ID can be validated
Measurable Description
Text description of measurable (e.g. inventory item or other identifier)
Start Time
Start time of the duration being measured
End Time
End time of the duration being measured
Quantity
A class that specifies a value of measurable in UOM code.
Value
The numerical amount of a specified item or resource.
Measurement Unit
The reference association to the Measurement Unit class, which is a class documents the units of measure utilized across various business documents and accounting ledgers.
UOM Code
The unique code for the unit of measure used in transactions.
Account SA

Tuple: parent container for account numbers and identifiers. No entry is made here, but each detail line may have multiple accounts assigned to it for reporting in different GAAPs, offsetting accounts in Japan, passing along information to consolidation systems about local versus consolidating accounts, etc. For example, the account 4783HG-QOWI-192837-1000 may be expressed so: /account/accountMainID 1000 /account/accountMainDescription Cash /account/accountSub/accountSubID 4783HG /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Department /account/accountSub/accountSubID QOWI /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Branch /account/accountSub/accountSubID 192837 /account/accountSub/accountSubDescription Division
Account Number

Main account - the code used to identify the accounting bucket the entry has been assigned to. Examples might be 1000 for Cash, 567GAAZ for Sales Expense or Z for tax payments. Identifiers such as department, branch, division, manager, or other modifiers are noted in the Subaccount area. Before needing to post, account is not necessary. Posting to the general ledger almost always requires an entry here.
Subaccount SA
Tuple to hold multiple accountSubIDs and Descriptions
Code

Where the primary account was placed in accountMainID, the code used for each profit center, division, gl-business unit, fund, program, branch, project, class, su-class or other modifier is placed here.
Type

Type of sub-account - profit center, division, gl-business unit, fund, program, branch, project, class, su-class or other modifier is placed here. For example:: Accountability center: gl-business unit: Class:Department: Project: Fund: Program:Job: Profit center: Branch: Setup class: Division: Unit
